raw_text: Apart from SimRank, extensions of PageRankare the main methods for computing the similarity of nodes in graphs in NLP (e.g., HughesandRamage (2007), Agirre et al (2009) and other papers discussed in related work)

The most commonly used similarity measures are based on the WordNet lexical database (eg Budanitsky and Hirst 2006, Hughes and Ramage 2007) and a number of such measures have been made publicly available (Pedersenet-al 2004)

Examples include summarization (Barzilay and Elhadad, 1999), question answering (Lin and Pantel, 2001), and textual entailment (Mirkin et al, 2006) .Graph-based methods have been successfully applied to evaluate word similarity using available ontologies, where the underlying graph included word senses and semantic relationships between them (Hughes and Ramage, 2007)
